physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Best-corrected visual acuity measured at 20/32, circumferential constriction in visual field to within 8Â° of fixation. Fundus exam showed inferior temporal optic nerve head hemangioblastoma measuring 1.0 mm, and peripheral inferotemporal retinal angioma.
Visual acuity improved to 20/20 and marked improvement in visual field noted.
Visual acuity improved to 20/16. Humphy automated perimetry mean deviation improved from -25.4 to -1.05 dB.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No change observed in lesion size.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity, contrast sensitivity, and visual fields remained normal.
Exudation and edema noted at the inferotemporal retinal angioma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity decreased to 20/32, slight loss in contrast sensitivity observed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Postoperative best-corrected visual acuity returned to 20/16.
Visual acuity was 20/13, normal visual field, normal contrast sensitivity. No change in ocular lesions.
